intro: Aster moupinensis, commonly known as the Moupin aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
